page.title: 08Thurnham
page.content: The level of the salt marshes is being raised due to Spartina Grass growing in recent years. There are many wild flowers. It is a site of special scientific interest. Samphire grows which is delicious to eat as a vegetable or pickled. Cowslips, primroses are amoung many flowers growing in hedgerows and meadows. The sea wall is ablaze with flowers in spring and summer. Last year there were three Great Mullein plants on the shore. The hawthorn hedges are a mass of blossom and dog roses in summer. Goose grass locally known as "Sticky Willie" is very common.
